content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it's great!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: OK @shake_24 for your Contribution.
-> my Python Solution :

def isPrime(n):
    for i in range(2, n//2+1):
        if n%i == 0: return 0
    return 1
x = int(input())
v = 2
for i in range(1, x+1):
    while(not isPrime(v)): v += 1
    print(str(v) + ": " + "*"*i + "_" + "*"*(v-i))
    v += 1

Hi @shake_24 : i think your explanations are not very easy to understand after the first reading,
-> but Validator 1 and Test 2 helped me a lot to understand your goal ...
=> so, i can upVote for your Contribution :-) !

Goal
* Suggest to change "You" to "Given an integer [[X]], you".

* Please format "X" as a [[variable]].

* Please format "2" and "_" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Please change "2:*_*" to "{{2: *_*}}" (note that you missed a space after the colon).

* Suggest to change "(2 is the 1st prime number): X asterisks (add ‘_’ after position 1, because this is line number 1)." to:

The first prime number is 2, hence there are 2 asterisks. It is the first line, hence {{_}} appears after 1 asterisk.

Output
* Please simplify as follows:

<<[[X]] lines>>: A string showing the prime number, the asterisks and {{_}} in the following format:
[[prime_number]]{{: }}[[asterisks and _]]

Constraints
* Please format "X" as a [[variable]].

Cases
* Please revise the cases so that they are all different.

Thanks.
Thank you !! I tried to apply the changes you recommend me.

Hi @Jp82. Thank you for your upvote and your comment !!
I´ll try to make easier my explanation...

Thank you. There are still some points not yet followed up:

Goal
* Please format "X" as a [[variable]].

Cases
* Please revise the cases so that they are all different (i.e. Test 1, Validator 1, Test 2, Validator 2, etc should all be different).

Thanks again.

Sorry for my errors... It´s my first contribution and I try to do my best.

I changed X in the Goal (I hope it´s fine).

In Cases I don´t know how to write Tests and Validators. If you can write me and example of both.

Thank you very much !

No worries!

For the cases, normally each pair of test and validator should be similar. In your clash, you may consider having small numbers in earlier tests, and larger numbers in later tests, e.g.
Test 1: 2
Validator 1: 3
Test 2: 11
Validator 2: 10
etc.

In each pair, sometimes [[X]] is larger in the test, and sometimes [[X]] is smaller in the test. That'll make a better balance.

Hope this clarifies.

I aplied last change (I hope it´s ok).

Thank you for your support !
